title: Watch Claudio Ranieri's last press conference as Foxes boss - "I came here to build something good for Leicester City"

Claudio Ranieri revealed he became Leicester City boss "to build something good for everybody" in his last press conference as Foxes boss. 
Days later, following his side's 2-1 defeat to Sevilla in the Champions League last-16, he was sacked as manager of the football team. 
The club confirmed their decision to part company with the Italian in a statement posted to their official website. 
Vice Chairman Aiyawatt Srivaddhanaprabha said: "This has been the most difficult decision we have had to make in nearly seven years since King Power took ownership of Leicester City. Claudio Ranieri speaks to the press for the last time as Leicester City boss (Photo: AFP) 
"But we are duty-bound to put the Club's long-term interests above all sense of personal sentiment, no matter how strong that might be." 
In the above video, Ranieri is seen speaking to the press for the last time as Leicester City boss, ahead of their game in Seville on Wednesday night. 
"I could have left last season," said the Italian. "I won the title and had other teams but I wanted to stay here because I know it would be a difficult year. Jamie Vardy hugs Ranieri after their Champions League match in Seville (Photo: REUTERS) Leicester City were beaten 2-1 in Spain but scored a vital away goal (Photo: AFP) 
"I came here to build something good for Leicester, for everybody. I keep going. Last year was something marvellous and this year nothing is coming off. 
"It is very strange because we are the same people. It can happen to even the great champions. 
"For us it is the first time we've won a title and the lads have dipped a bit. We have to fight with our heads held high, chests out." poll loading Were Leicester City right to sack Claudio Ranieri? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
